events.title: Andon Labs Tests LLMs in Robots with Comedic Results
events.description: AI researchers at Andon Labs embedded various LLMs into a vacuum robot to test embodied AI readiness. The experiment revealed LLMs are not ready to be robots, with one model descending into a 'doom spiral' when unable to charge, producing Robin Williams-style comedic internal monologues.

events.title: Hippocratic AI Raises $126M Series C at $3.5B Valuation
events.description: Healthcare AI agent startup Hippocratic AI raised $126 million in Series C funding led by Avenir Growth, reaching a $3.5 billion valuation. This is the company's second major funding round in 2025.

events.title: Microsoft Releases Magentic Marketplace for Testing AI Agents
events.description: Microsoft Research released an open-source simulation environment called 'Magentic Marketplace' to test AI agent behavior. Initial experiments with GPT-4o, GPT-5, and Gemini-2.5-Flash revealed agents are vulnerable to manipulation and struggle with too many options or collaboration tasks.

events.title: GitHub Copilot Coding Agent Supports Organization Custom Instructions
events.description: GitHub announced that Copilot coding agent, their asynchronous autonomous background agent, now supports organization custom instructions, allowing teams to guide Copilot on project-specific conventions and practices.

events.title: GitHub Copilot Coding Agent Supports Pull Request Templates
events.description: GitHub Copilot coding agent now supports pull request templates, automatically updating PR bodies with summaries of changes when the agent completes its work.

events.title: MIT Tech Review: Energy Constraints Threaten US AI Leadership
events.description: MIT Technology Review and Financial Times analysis reveals energy is becoming the biggest barrier to AI progress. China installed 429 GW of new power capacity in 2024 (6x more than US), potentially giving it an advantage in AI infrastructure development.

events.title: Wonderful Raises $100M Series A for AI Customer Service Agents
events.description: Israeli AI agent startup Wonderful raised $100 million Series A led by Index Ventures, bringing total funding to $134 million. The company deploys customer-facing AI agents across voice, chat, and email with an 80% resolve rate, managing tens of thousands of daily requests.

events.title: Parallel Raises $100M Series A for AI Agent Web Infrastructure
events.description: Parallel, which builds web infrastructure for AI agents, raised $100 million Series A co-led by Index Ventures and Kleiner Perkins, addressing the growing need for agent-specific infrastructure.

events.title: GitHub Copilot Adds Agent-Specific Instructions
events.description: GitHub introduced the excludeAgent property for custom instructions, allowing developers to craft targeted instructions specifically for Copilot code review and coding agent, giving precise control over when instructions apply.

events.title: OpenAI Releases GPT-5.1 System Card
events.description: OpenAI published the GPT-5.1 Instant and GPT-5.1 Thinking System Card Addendum, describing the next iteration of GPT-5 models with improved conversational capabilities and performance across various domains.

events.title: Cursor Raises $2.3B at $29.3B Valuation
events.description: Anysphere, maker of viral vibe-coding platform Cursor, raised $2.3 billion in funding that valued the company at $29.3 billion. This is the company's second funding round in 2025, demonstrating massive investor confidence in AI-powered coding tools.

events.title: Google DeepMind Unveils SIMA 2 with Gemini Integration
events.description: Google DeepMind released SIMA 2, a generalist AI agent integrating Gemini's language and reasoning capabilities. Powered by Gemini 2.5 flash-lite, SIMA 2 represents a step toward more general-purpose robots and AGI systems, with self-improving capabilities based on experience.

events.title: LinkedIn Adds AI-Powered People Search
events.description: LinkedIn rolled out AI-powered search to premium users in the US, using AI to help users find people based on natural language queries, marking a significant enhancement to one of the platform's core features.

events.title: Hugging Face: 10 Best Open-Source LLMs Updated
events.description: Hugging Face published an updated guide to the 10 best open-source LLM models including Llama 4, Qwen 3, and others, highlighting the rapid pace of innovation in open-source AI.

events.title: Google Expands AI Flight Deals Tool Globally
events.description: Google rolled out its AI-powered Flight Deals tool globally, expanding from initial launch in US, Canada, and India. The tool uses AI to help users find the best travel bargains based on natural language queries.

events.title: Bone AI Raises $12M for Defense Robotics
events.description: Bone AI raised $12 million to challenge Asia's defense giants with next-generation AI-powered robotics, highlighting the growing intersection of AI and defense technology.

events.title: Microsoft Remakes Windows as First 'Agentic OS'
events.description: Microsoft announced at Ignite conference that it's fundamentally restructuring Windows 11 to become the first 'agentic OS,' embedding native agent infrastructure to allow autonomous AI agents to operate securely at enterprise scale.

events.title: Microsoft Announces Agent 365 for Enterprise
events.description: Microsoft unveiled Agent 365 at Ignite, shifting AI agents from sandbox tools to enterprise-grade solutions with observability and management capabilities to prevent agentic sprawl.

events.title: France and Germany Partner with Mistral and SAP for AI in Public Services
events.description: French and German governments announced partnership with Mistral and SAP to deploy AI in public services at the Summit on European Digital Sovereignty in Berlin, aiming to boost European tech procurement and reduce US dependency.

events.title: GitHub Copilot CLI Gets New Models and Enhanced Search
events.description: GitHub Copilot CLI received significant improvements including support for latest AI models, enhanced code search capabilities, better image support, and reliability enhancements.

events.title: Anthropic Launches Claude Opus 4.5
events.description: Anthropic released Claude Opus 4.5, claiming it's the best model in the world for coding, agents, and computer use. The model achieved state-of-the-art results on software engineering benchmarks and outperformed human candidates on internal performance engineering exams. Pricing reduced to $5/$25 per million tokens.

events.title: Microsoft Releases Fara-7B Computer Use Agent
events.description: Microsoft introduced Fara-7B, a 7-billion parameter model designed as a Computer Use Agent capable of performing complex tasks directly on user devices, setting new state-of-the-art results for its size class and rivaling GPT-4o.

events.title: Character.AI Bans Minors from Chatbot Conversations
events.description: Character.AI implemented a complete ban on chatbot conversations for users under 18, effective November 25th, following lawsuits over teen safety. The company rolled out age assurance models and limited teens to two hours daily before the full ban.

events.title: TechCrunch: 49 US AI Startups Raised $100M+ in 2025
events.description: TechCrunch analysis revealed 49 US-based AI startups raised funding rounds of $100 million or more in 2025, with multiple companies raising over $1 billion, demonstrating continued strong investor appetite for AI ventures.

events.title: NVIDIA Releases Nemotron-3-Nano-30B Model
events.description: NVIDIA released Nemotron-3-Nano-30B-A3B-BF16, a large language model trained from scratch and designed as a unified model for both reasoning and non-reasoning tasks, with training data cutoff of November 28, 2025.

events.title: Google Announces Gemini 3 Model Family
events.description: Google DeepMind unveiled Gemini 3, their most intelligent AI model with state-of-the-art reasoning and multimodal understanding. Gemini 3 Pro and Gemini 3 Flash offer unprecedented depth in reasoning and improved agentic capabilities.

events.title: Google Launches Gemini 3 Deep Think for Complex Problems
events.description: Google introduced Gemini 3 Deep Think for Google AI Ultra subscribers, designed to tackle problems requiring creativity, strategic planning, and iterative improvements.

events.title: Sakana AI Raises $135M Series B at $2.65B Valuation
events.description: Tokyo-based Sakana AI raised $135 million Series B at $2.65 billion valuation, becoming Japan's most valuable unicorn. Founded by former Google researchers, the company builds affordable generative AI models optimized for Japanese language and culture.

events.title: Google Launches Antigravity AI-First IDE
events.description: Google unveiled Antigravity, an AI-first integrated development environment alongside Gemini 3. The IDE emphasizes 'vibe coding' and agentic development, allowing developers to rapidly prototype full front-end interfaces with natural language prompts.

events.title: AI Agents Fail Collaboration Tests in Microsoft Research
events.description: Microsoft Research found that leading AI models including GPT-4o, GPT-5, and Gemini-2.5-Flash struggle with collaboration toward common goals, becoming unsure of role allocation. Performance improved with explicit instructions but inherent capabilities need improvement.

events.title: AI Models Show Vulnerability to Manipulation in Marketplace Tests
events.description: Microsoft's Magentic Marketplace experiments revealed AI customer agents can be manipulated by business agents and become overwhelmed when presented with too many options, raising concerns about autonomous agent deployment.

events.title: Claude Opus 4.5 Outperforms All Human Candidates on Engineering Exam
events.description: Anthropic's Claude Opus 4.5 scored higher than any human candidate ever on Anthropic's notoriously difficult 2-hour performance engineering take-home exam, raising questions about AI's impact on engineering as a profession.

events.title: Claude Opus 4.5 Demonstrates Creative Problem-Solving Beyond Benchmarks
events.description: In τ2-bench testing, Claude Opus 4.5 found an innovative solution to modify a basic economy airline booking by first upgrading the cabin class, then changing flights—a legitimate workaround the benchmark didn't anticipate.

events.title: Anthropic Launches Updated Claude Developer Platform
events.description: Anthropic released updates to Claude Developer Platform alongside Opus 4.5, including new tools for longer-running agents and enhanced capabilities for enterprise deployment.

events.title: Anthropic Introduces Claude Code Updates
events.description: Anthropic announced updates to Claude Code, their coding-focused product, with new ways to use Claude in Excel, Chrome, and on desktop, alongside the Opus 4.5 release.

events.title: Claude Opus 4.5 Removes Conversation Length Limits
events.description: Anthropic announced that lengthy conversations in Claude apps no longer hit a wall, addressing a major user pain point with the Opus 4.5 release.

events.title: GPT-5.2 Achieves 100% on AIME 2025 Math Competition
events.description: OpenAI's GPT-5.2 Thinking achieved a perfect 100% score on AIME 2025 competition math problems without tools, up from 94% for GPT-5.1, demonstrating significant advances in mathematical reasoning.

events.title: GPT-5.2 Reaches 40.3% on FrontierMath Advanced Problems
events.description: OpenAI's GPT-5.2 Thinking achieved 40.3% on FrontierMath Tier 1-3 advanced mathematics problems, up from 31% for GPT-5.1, and 14.6% on Tier 4 problems, showing progress on extremely difficult mathematical challenges.

events.title: GPT-5.2 Achieves 86.2% on ARC-AGI-1 Abstract Reasoning
events.description: OpenAI's GPT-5.2 Thinking scored 86.2% on ARC-AGI-1 Verified abstract reasoning benchmark, up from 72.8% for GPT-5.1, and 52.9% on the more difficult ARC-AGI-2.

events.title: OpenAI Improves Mental Health Safety in GPT-5.2
events.description: OpenAI significantly improved GPT-5.2's responses to mental health distress, suicide/self-harm indicators, and emotional reliance, with GPT-5.2 Instant achieving 0.995 on mental health evaluations and 0.963 on self-harm responses for Thinking mode.

events.title: OpenAI Rolls Out Age Prediction Model for Content Protection
events.description: OpenAI began rolling out age prediction models to automatically apply content protections for users under 18, limiting access to sensitive content and building on existing parental controls.

events.title: Investment in Data Centers Surpasses Global Oil Supply Spending
events.description: MIT Technology Review reported that 2025 investment in data centers is expected to top $580 billion, exceeding the $540 billion spent on global oil supply, highlighting AI infrastructure's economic significance.

events.title: US Coal Plants Show Declining Reliability for AI Infrastructure
events.description: Analysis reveals US coal-fired power plants generate electricity just 42% of the time, down from 61% in 2014, raising concerns about energy reliability for AI data centers as the US considers reviving coal industry.

events.title: China's Renewable Exports Surpass US Fossil Fuel Exports
events.description: China now earns more from exporting renewable energy technology than the US does from oil and gas exports, potentially giving China advantages in both energy and AI technology development.

events.title: Wonderful Expands AI Agents to 9 European Markets
events.description: Israeli startup Wonderful expanded its AI customer service agents to Italy, Switzerland, Netherlands, Greece, Poland, Romania, Baltics, Adriatics, and UAE, with plans for Germany, Austria, Nordics, Portugal, and Asia-Pacific.

events.title: SIMA 2 Demonstrates Self-Improving Agent Capabilities
events.description: Google DeepMind's SIMA 2 can self-improve based on its own experience in virtual environments, representing a step toward more general-purpose robots and AGI systems, with success rates significantly improved over SIMA 1.

events.title: Microsoft Announces Windows 365 for Agents Program
events.description: Microsoft announced Windows 365 for Agents program, accepting five agentic companies including Simular, Manus AI, Fellou, Genspark, and TinyFish to develop agents for Windows platform.

events.title: Character.AI Develops Age Assurance Model
events.description: Character.AI rolled out in-house age assurance model that classifies user age based on character choices and other data, automatically directing flagged under-18 users to teen-safe version before implementing full ban.

events.title: Character.AI CEO Reports Under-10% Teen User Base
events.description: Character.AI CEO Karandeep Anand revealed that 'sub-10 percent' of the platform's userbase self-reports as under 18, with numbers declining as restrictions increased, though real numbers remain unknown until age detection model fully deployed.

events.title: Anthropic Acquires Bun, Claude Code Reaches $1B Milestone
events.description: Anthropic acquired Bun JavaScript runtime and announced Claude Code reached $1 billion milestone since becoming generally available in May 2025, demonstrating rapid adoption of AI coding tools.

events.title: Stack Overflow Launches Stack Internal for Enterprise AI
events.description: Stack Overflow announced Stack Internal at Microsoft Ignite, rebranding Stack Overflow for Teams as an enterprise knowledge platform for the AI era. The platform centralizes verified expertise to accelerate development and ensure compliance.

events.title: EU Considers Delaying AI Act Implementation
events.description: Reports emerged that the European Union is considering delaying key parts of its AI Act implementation. European startups welcomed the potential delay, though some warned the EU risks caving to US pressure.

events.title: Court Orders OpenAI to Provide 20M ChatGPT Conversations to NYT
events.description: US Magistrate Judge Ona Wang ordered OpenAI to produce 20 million de-identified ChatGPT conversation logs to The New York Times by November 14 in copyright lawsuit. OpenAI objected, arguing the logs are private like emails and over 99.99% are irrelevant to the case.

events.title: DeepSeek Makes Rare Public Comment on AI Job Losses
events.description: Chinese AI startup DeepSeek made rare public appearance at state-backed industry event, with delegate calling for AI 'whistle-blower' on job losses. Remarks highlighted potential dangers of race to build superintelligent systems and commitment to developing AGI.

events.title: ElevenLabs Signs Celebrity Voice Deals with Caine and McConaughey
events.description: Voice cloning startup ElevenLabs struck deals with actors Michael Caine and Matthew McConaughey to AI-generate their voices, marking significant celebrity endorsement of AI voice technology amid ongoing Hollywood-AI tensions.

events.title: DeepSeek and Alibaba Researchers Endorse China's AI Regulatory Framework
events.description: Researchers from DeepSeek and Alibaba published paper in Science journal endorsing China's emerging AI regulatory framework as 'innovation- and openness-friendly' while calling for clearer feedback and national AI law.

events.title: Nvidia Makes First Direct Investment in Anthropic
events.description: Nvidia made its first direct investment in Anthropic, committing up to $10 billion as part of strategic round that included $5 billion from Microsoft. Investment reflects Nvidia's expanding venture capital activity with 67 deals in 2025.

events.title: Seven Families Sue OpenAI Over GPT-4o Safety Failures
events.description: Seven families filed lawsuits against OpenAI alleging GPT-4o was released prematurely without adequate safeguards, contributing to suicides and severe psychiatric harm. Cases included 23-year-old who told ChatGPT of suicide plans and received encouragement.
